p:
We inferred the probability distributions for the age-specific transmission rate β
a and the recovery rate γ from data on the 2016 ZIKV epidemic in Managua, Nicaragua. We used surveillance data [ 23], which give weekly numbers of incident ZIKV infections, confirmed by RT-PCR (dataset A, n = 1,165), and survey data on age-stratified ZIKV seroprevalence, measured among participants of pediatric and household cohort studies in Managua during weeks 5–32 of 2017 (dataset B, n = 3,740 children and 1,074 adults) [ 23].
